other_tests.procedure_name: Excisional biopsy of a left occipital lymph node
other_tests.findings: Pathological examination revealed changes thought to suggest dermatopathic lymphadenitis.
Examination of the aspirate and biopsy specimen showed trilineage hematopoiesis, with myeloid hyperplasia and no malignant cells.

other_tests.procedure_name: Excisional biopsy of a right cervical lymph node
other_tests.findings: Pathological examination revealed follicular hyperplasia and focal paracortical expansion, with vascular proliferation and a polymorphous population of small lymphocytes, immunoblasts, plasma cells, and eosinophils.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Immunophenotyping studies showed T cells and polyclonal B cells, with no evidence of EBV infection.

other_tests.findings: Histological features were found highly suggestive of angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma (AITL).
other_tests.changes_over_time: In the second biopsy, predominant medium-size CD4+ T cells with clear cytoplasm coexpressing CD10 and CXCL13, indicative of AITL.
